back_cards.definition_en: A person or group hostile to another.
back_cards.example_en: The two countries were enemies during the war.

back_cards.definition_en: Something harmful or destructive.
back_cards.example_en: Rust is the enemy of metal tools.

back_cards.definition_en: An opponent in a conflict or competition.
back_cards.example_en: He faced his enemy in the final chess match.

back_cards.definition_en: A rival in a personal or professional context.
back_cards.example_en: She saw her coworker as an enemy after the promotion.

back_cards.definition_en: A force or entity that opposes progress.
back_cards.example_en: Fear is often the enemy of success.

back_cards.definition_en: Physical harm or destruction to an object.
back_cards.example_en: The flood caused severe damage to the house.

back_cards.definition_en: Negative impact on something intangible.
back_cards.example_en: The scandal brought damage to his reputation.

back_cards.definition_en: Financial loss or liability.
back_cards.example_en: The company paid for the damage to her car.

back_cards.definition_en: An injury affecting functionality or appearance.
back_cards.example_en: The storm left visible damage on the trees.

back_cards.definition_en: A setback or harm in a project or plan.
back_cards.example_en: Delays caused damage to the construction schedule.

back_cards.definition_en: A living creature or entity.
back_cards.example_en: The forest is home to many strange beings.

back_cards.definition_en: The state or fact of existence.
back_cards.example_en: Her philosophy explored the nature of being.

back_cards.definition_en: A person or thing that exists in a certain way.
back_cards.example_en: He was a kind being, always helping others.

back_cards.definition_en: The essence or core of something.
back_cards.example_en: Love is at the heart of her being.

back_cards.definition_en: A supernatural or fictional entity.
back_cards.example_en: The story featured a magical being from another world.

back_cards.definition_en: A severe weather event with wind and rain.
back_cards.example_en: The storm knocked out power in the town.

back_cards.definition_en: A sudden or violent disturbance.
back_cards.example_en: A storm of protests followed the decision.

back_cards.definition_en: An intense emotional outburst.
back_cards.example_en: She left the room in a storm of anger.

back_cards.definition_en: A rapid and forceful attack.
back_cards.example_en: The troops launched a storm on the fortress.

back_cards.definition_en: A period of chaotic activity.
back_cards.example_en: The office was a storm of activity before the deadline.

back_cards.definition_en: The physical form or outline of an object.
back_cards.example_en: The cloud had the shape of a heart.

back_cards.definition_en: The condition or state of something.
back_cards.example_en: He’s in great shape after months of training.

back_cards.definition_en: A specific type or form of something.
back_cards.example_en: The project is taking shape as we speak.

back_cards.definition_en: A mold or pattern for creating something.
back_cards.example_en: She used a cookie cutter to make star shapes.

back_cards.definition_en: A figure or silhouette in art or design.
back_cards.example_en: The painting featured bold geometric shapes.

back_cards.definition_en: A round container for food or liquids.
back_cards.example_en: She served soup in a ceramic bowl.

back_cards.definition_en: A dish or portion served in such a container.
back_cards.example_en: He ate a bowl of cereal for breakfast.

back_cards.definition_en: A stadium or arena for sports events.
back_cards.example_en: The football game was held at the Rose Bowl.

back_cards.definition_en: A curved or hollow structure.
back_cards.example_en: The bowl of the pipe was carved from wood.

back_cards.definition_en: A game or activity, like lawn bowling.
back_cards.example_en: They played a friendly game of bowls in the park.

back_cards.definition_en: A group appointed to perform specific duties.
back_cards.example_en: The commission investigated the accident.

back_cards.definition_en: A fee paid for services, often in sales.
back_cards.example_en: She earned a high commission from the deal.

back_cards.definition_en: An official order or authority.
back_cards.example_en: He received a commission as an army officer.

back_cards.definition_en: A work or project assigned to someone.
back_cards.example_en: The artist accepted a commission for a portrait.

back_cards.definition_en: The act of granting authority or power.
back_cards.example_en: The new law was put into commission last week.

back_cards.definition_en: The leader of a ship or aircraft.
back_cards.example_en: The captain navigated the ship through the storm.

back_cards.definition_en: The head of a sports team.
back_cards.example_en: She was elected captain of the soccer team.

back_cards.definition_en: A military officer of a specific rank.
back_cards.example_en: The captain led his unit into battle.

back_cards.definition_en: A person in charge of a group or activity.
back_cards.example_en: He acted as captain of the debate club.

back_cards.definition_en: A figure of authority in a specific field.
back_cards.example_en: The industry captain influenced market trends.

back_cards.definition_en: The organ of hearing on the side of the head.
back_cards.example_en: She whispered softly into his ear.

back_cards.definition_en: The part of a plant, like corn, bearing seeds.
back_cards.example_en: The farmer harvested ears of corn from the field.

back_cards.definition_en: The ability to hear or listen attentively.
back_cards.example_en: She has a good ear for music.

back_cards.definition_en: A feature resembling the shape of an ear.
back_cards.example_en: The vase had handles shaped like ears.

back_cards.definition_en: Attention or awareness given to something.
back_cards.example_en: Her complaints fell on deaf ears.

back_cards.definition_en: A group of soldiers or military personnel.
back_cards.example_en: The troop marched in formation during the parade.

back_cards.definition_en: A collection of people or animals moving together.
back_cards.example_en: A troop of monkeys swung through the trees.

back_cards.definition_en: A unit in scouting organizations.
back_cards.example_en: The scout troop went camping in the forest.

back_cards.definition_en: A large number of individuals in action.
back_cards.example_en: A troop of volunteers cleaned the park.

back_cards.definition_en: A band or group in a specific context.
back_cards.example_en: The theater troop performed a new play.

back_cards.definition_en: A person or animal of the female sex.
back_cards.example_en: The female of the species guards the nest.

back_cards.definition_en: A woman or girl in a specific role.
back_cards.example_en: She was the only female in the engineering team.

back_cards.definition_en: A biological or gender category.
back_cards.example_en: The survey asked if participants were male or female.

back_cards.definition_en: A representative of women in a group.
back_cards.example_en: The female led the discussion on workplace equality.

back_cards.definition_en: A term used in technical contexts, like connectors.
back_cards.example_en: The cable has a female plug on one end.

back_cards.definition_en: The hard material from trees used for building.
back_cards.example_en: The table was made of polished wood.

back_cards.definition_en: A forested area or collection of trees.
back_cards.example_en: They went hiking in the wood near the lake.

back_cards.definition_en: A material for fuel or crafting.
back_cards.example_en: He chopped wood for the fireplace.

back_cards.definition_en: A type of club used in golf.
back_cards.example_en: She used a wood to hit the golf ball.

back_cards.definition_en: A texture or finish resembling timber.
back_cards.example_en: The car’s interior had a wood grain design.

back_cards.definition_en: Having a moderately high temperature.
back_cards.example_en: The warm water felt soothing after a long day.

back_cards.definition_en: Friendly or affectionate in manner.
back_cards.example_en: Her warm smile made everyone feel welcome.

back_cards.definition_en: Comfortable or cozy in feeling.
back_cards.example_en: The blanket kept her warm during the cold night.

back_cards.definition_en: Close to achieving a goal or answer.
back_cards.example_en: You’re getting warm in this guessing game.

back_cards.definition_en: Rich or vibrant, as in colors or tones.
back_cards.example_en: The painting used warm shades of orange and red.

back_cards.definition_en: Free from dirt or impurities.
back_cards.example_en: The kitchen was spotless and clean after scrubbing.

back_cards.definition_en: Morally pure or free from wrongdoing.
back_cards.example_en: He has a clean record with no arrests.

back_cards.definition_en: Neat or well-organized in appearance.
back_cards.example_en: Her desk was always clean and tidy.

back_cards.definition_en: Complete or thorough, as in a break.
back_cards.example_en: The bone healed after a clean fracture.

back_cards.definition_en: Fair or honest, as in competition.
back_cards.example_en: The team played a clean game with no fouls.

back_cards.definition_en: To guide or direct a person or group.
back_cards.example_en: She will lead the team to the conference room.

back_cards.definition_en: To be in front or ahead in a competition.
back_cards.example_en: He leads the race by a narrow margin.

back_cards.definition_en: To cause or result in something.
back_cards.example_en: Hard work can lead to great success.

back_cards.definition_en: To serve as a route or path.
back_cards.example_en: This road leads to the beach.

back_cards.definition_en: To take charge of an initiative or project.
back_cards.example_en: She leads the charity’s fundraising efforts.

back_cards.definition_en: A high-ranking government official.
back_cards.example_en: The minister of education announced new policies.

back_cards.definition_en: A religious leader or clergy member.
back_cards.example_en: The minister delivered a sermon at the church.

back_cards.definition_en: A diplomat representing a country.
back_cards.example_en: The foreign minister met with international leaders.

back_cards.definition_en: A person who provides aid or service.
back_cards.example_en: She acted as a minister to the sick and elderly.

back_cards.definition_en: An agent or representative of a cause.
back_cards.example_en: He was a minister of peace during the negotiations.

back_cards.definition_en: A person living nearby.
back_cards.example_en: My neighbor helped me fix my fence.

back_cards.definition_en: Someone or something located close by.
back_cards.example_en: The store is a neighbor to the post office.

back_cards.definition_en: A fellow person in a community.
back_cards.example_en: We should treat every neighbor with kindness.

back_cards.definition_en: A country bordering another.
back_cards.example_en: Canada is a friendly neighbor to the United States.

back_cards.definition_en: A person sharing a common space.
back_cards.example_en: Her neighbor in the office shared the printer.

back_cards.definition_en: Very small in size or amount.
back_cards.example_en: The tiny kitten fit in the palm of her hand.

back_cards.definition_en: Insignificant or minor in importance.
back_cards.example_en: He made a tiny mistake in the report.

back_cards.definition_en: Delicate or fine in structure.
back_cards.example_en: The necklace had a tiny charm shaped like a star.

back_cards.definition_en: Limited or confined in space.
back_cards.example_en: They lived in a tiny apartment in the city.

back_cards.definition_en: Young or small, as in age or stature.
back_cards.example_en: The tiny toddler took her first steps.

back_cards.definition_en: Related to the mind or intellect.
back_cards.example_en: She practices mental exercises to stay sharp.

back_cards.definition_en: Concerning psychological health.
back_cards.example_en: He sought help for mental stress after work.

back_cards.definition_en: Done or occurring in the mind.
back_cards.example_en: She made a mental note to call later.

back_cards.definition_en: Involving cognitive processes.
back_cards.example_en: The game requires mental strategy and focus.

back_cards.definition_en: Pertaining to disorders of the mind.
back_cards.example_en: The clinic specializes in mental health care.

back_cards.definition_en: Programs used to operate computers.
back_cards.example_en: She installed new software for editing photos.

back_cards.definition_en: A set of instructions for digital devices.
back_cards.example_en: The software controls the robot’s movements.

back_cards.definition_en: Tools for specific tasks or applications.
back_cards.example_en: He uses accounting software for his business.

back_cards.definition_en: A product in the tech industry.
back_cards.example_en: The company develops software for schools.

back_cards.definition_en: The non-physical part of computing.
back_cards.example_en: The software update fixed the phone’s bugs.
